Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2008 07:02PM Nova wrote: Hi Anne, We have spent most of the evening printing out threads of recommendations. Our biggest concern is going to be where she is most comfortable... The doctor's were leaning towards a mastectomy but gave her the choice between lumpectomy and mast. Her biggest concern of the entire situation was reconstruction, not necessarily if to have it but would it be good enough??? She is horribly afraid of the scars and the body she will be left with. Once she told the doctor today what she decided he told her that her oncologist and he talked and both felt that would be the best route for her. We managed to get a load of information and after her visit with the plastic surgeon she was convinced of what she felt was right for her. She wants this surgery over with. She found out 9 weeks ago about this. We have changed doctors because she wasn't comfortable with the first set. She has made it really clear she is ready to get this done. Now our taskÂ is the prepping for everything. One person compared it to getting ready for a trip... that's just how we feel right now. I feel like she was handling everything fine so far. Now she is a bundle of nerves. We are looking up all kinds of stuff and going through her clothes tonight. Then we'll make a "list" and get what we need. We feel so overwhelmed with the fact that there doesn't feel to be "control" over the situation which is not in either one of our natures to deal with!!
